item.title: A Clarification About the Same-Origin Policy
item.description: 转自我在 Stackoverflow 的回答: I finally made myself clear after having been struggling half a hour about this saying: Cross-origin writes are typically allowed…. Cross-origin embedding is typically allowed…. Cross-origin reads are typically not allowed… To better understand with these three phrases, the first thing you need to keep in mind is that same-origin policy is about restricting access the loaded result from one origin to another origin, within your browser, so it does nothing directly to do with cross-origin requesting, which involves requesting to the server.
